name: Sonarr
desc: Deploy Sonarr to manage and automate the downloading of TV shows. Sonarr is designed to simplify the process of obtaining episodes from various sources while maintaining a clean and organized library.
longDesc:
Sonarr is an open-source application that acts as a PVR (personal video recorder) for TV series. It allows users to track their favorite shows, automatically download new episodes, and organize their media library.

**Key Features:**
- **One-Click Deployment:** Easily set up Sonarr using Docker or similar technologies for quick installation and access.
- **Scalability:** Capable of handling multiple shows and seasons, suitable for personal use or larger media libraries.
- **Privacy and Security:** Operates on the user's local network, giving them control over their media without relying on third-party services.
- **API Compatibility:** Integrates with various download clients and media servers via a robust API, enhancing automation and workflow.
- **Notification System:** Provides alerts and notifications for new episodes, ensuring users never miss an update.
useCases:
- **Media Enthusiasts:** Automate the downloading and organization of TV shows, ensuring a seamless viewing experience.
- **Families:** Set up a family media server that automatically updates with the latest episodes of favorite shows.
- **Developers:** Utilize the API to integrate Sonarr with other applications or services, creating a personalized media management solution.
support:
- **Community Forums:** Engage with other Sonarr users through the [Sonarr GitHub Repository](https://github.com/Sonarr/Sonarr) for support and discussions.
- **Documentation:** Comprehensive guides and setup instructions are available at the [Sonarr Documentation](https://sonarr.tv/) for detailed user reference.
- **Troubleshooting Help:** Access the Issues section on GitHub for community-contributed solutions and to report any bugs or feature requests.
